snippet: The conflicts are in many ways as complex as his business empire, adding a heightened degree of difficulty for Mr. Trump to separate his official duties from his private business affairs....
abstract: Donald Trump's far-flung business empire presents number of unprecedented difficulties in separating his official duties as president from his private business affairs; diminishing conflicts of interest has been made even more difficult by Trump's decision to include his three older children on his transition team; ethics lawyers say Trump's plan to hand over management of his company to his children would not amount to blind trust.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and SUSANNE CRAIG
byline.contributor: Eric Lipton reported from Washington, and Susanne Craig from New York.

lead_paragraph: The conflicts are in many ways as complex as his business empire, adding a heightened degree of difficulty for Mr. Trump to separate his official duties from his private business affairs.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Far-Flung Holdings Raise Potential for Conflicts of Interest
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Far-Flung Holdings Raise High Risk for Conflicts
